page.title: 02Lincolnshire Wolds cont
page.content: crops being mainly wheat, barley and rape. Other residents commute to neighbouring towns. Some houses have recently been built in Tathwell and Withcall, but due to the intensive nature of farming in the area it is unlikely that much land will be used for residential purposes. The farming methods employed,involving substantial use of chemicals, have had a significant effect on wildlife reducing the numbers of wild flowers drastically, and removing much of the habitat of small mammals, although hares and rabbits are still quite numerous. The presence of barn owls indicates that small rodents such as shrews and mice still exist in the area. Although not very high, this area is exposed to the winds from the North sea, and can be very bleak even in the summer.
